snippet: President Jacob Zuma is bringing his troops home after at least 13 soldiers were killed last month in a firefight with rebels who overthrew the Central African Republic’s president.
abstract: South African Pres Jacob Zuma says he will withdraw country's troops from Central African Republic, after 13 soldiers were killed in March during firefight with rebels who overthrew Pres Francois Bozize.

byline.original: By LYDIA POLGREEN and SCOTT SAYARE
byline.contributor: Lydia Polgreen reported from Johannesburg, and Scott Sayare from Paris. Benno Muchler contributed reporting from Bangui, Central African Republic.

lead_paragraph: President Jacob Zuma is bringing his troops home after at least 13 soldiers were killed last month in a firefight with rebels who overthrew the Central African Republic’s president.

headline.seo: South Africa to Withdraw Troops From Central African Republic
headline.main: South Africa to Withdraw Its Troops From Central African Republic
headline.print_headline: South Africa to Withdraw Its Troops From Central African Republic

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
